title: Why 'stay-at-home parent' is a job title
description: LinkedIn now gives parents a way to reflect a career gap. Can it help the return-to-work challenge?

title: Covid: 'Israel may be reaching herd immunity'
description: A leading doctor describes it as the "only explanation" for cases falling as restrictions are eased.

title: Rightmove says Cornwall's Newquay is hottest UK property market
description: Online property portal says the Cornish surfing town is the place where properties sell fastest.

title: Why $30m didn't protect Nigerian pupils after Chibok
description: The 2014 student abductions led to a plan backed by the UK but little has come of it seven years on.

title: Meet the songwriters who told pop stars: 'Don't steal from us'
description: A group of writers are exposing the dirty business of making pop hits, and campaigning for change.

title: LGBT homelessness: 'I had to pretend to be straight'
description: Lockdown has pushed some young LGBTQ people into homelessness rather than face abuse.

title: 'No say over my body': Alleged US ICE detainee medical abuse
description: Dozens of women allege they faced invasive gynaecological procedures while being held at a US immigration detention centre.

title: Lockdown learning 'made me feel a lot more confident'
description: Teenagers are due back in school next week but despite the challenges, some benefited from lockdown learning.

title: Semi-finals a great achievement, says Tuchel - but does he want Liverpool or Real?
description: Chelsea boss Thomas Tuchel says his side reaching the last four of the Champions League is a "great achievement" - but would he rather face Liverpool or Real Madrid?

title: Rare footage captures fight between two wild pandas
description: Some rare footage of two wild pandas having a fierce fight has been captured by researchers in China.

title: Is Russia going to war with Ukraine and other questions
description: What you need to know about Russia's troop build-up around eastern Ukraine.

title: Greensill: Labour urges 'full' probe into Cameron lobbying
description: The PM insists probe into David Cameron's lobbying will get free rein, but Labour say it's a "cover-up".

title: Covid: People 45 or over in England invited to book vaccine
description: It comes after all over-50s and those in high-risk groups in the UK have been offered a first dose.

title: Tottenham & Man City each get 2,000 EFL Cup final tickets - but no under-18s allowed
description: Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester City will both have 2,000 fans at Wembley for the EFL Cup final on 25 April.

title: Covid-19: US agencies call for pause in Johnson & Johnson vaccine
description: Federal agencies act out of an "abundance of caution" after extremely rare cases of blood clotting.

title: Covid-19 in Scotland: Travel ban to be lifted from Friday
description: People will be allowed to meet in larger groups outdoors and take day trips across Scotland from Friday.

title: Daunte Wright shooting: Dozens arrested in fresh unrest in Minnesota
description: The clashes come as police say Daunte Wright, 20, died after an officer mistook her gun for a Taser.

title: Jake Paul accused of sexual assault by Justine Paradise
description: The YouTuber has not yet commented on allegations from Paradise, a TikTok star.

title: Covid-19: England gets third jab as Moderna rollout begins
description: It offers an alternative to the AstraZeneca jab for under-30s, after very rare blood clot concerns.

title: MasterChef: Rescheduled final to air on Wednesday
description: The final of the BBC cooking show, delayed after Prince Philip's death, will air on Wednesday night.

title: Government's LGBT advisory panel disbanded
description: Three advisors quit last month in protest at the government's handling of LGBT rights.

title: The Simpsons: Hank Azaria apologises for voicing Indian character Apu
description: The actor says part of him feels he needs to apologise to 'every single Indian person'.

title: UK exports to EU rebound partially after January's slump
description: Despite the improvement, exports still remain below 2020 levels, the UK statistics body says.

title: Edinburgh's International Festival to be outdoors with shorter shows
description: Three temporary pavilions will be erected in Edinburgh Park and the University of Edinburgh's Old College Quad.

title: Covid: Younger Brazilians fall ill as cases explode
description: Research suggests more than half of patients being treated in intensive care last month were under 40.

title: Tyson Fury says Anthony Joshua bout will '100% happen' as deal moves close
description: Tyson Fury says he expects his fight with Anthony Joshua to be announced in the coming days.

title: Scotland head coach Townsend to be Lions attack coach
description: Gregor Townsend will lead the British and Irish Lions attack in South Africa - Steve Tandy, Robin McBryde and Neil Jenkins also on board.

title: Curry sets Warriors all-time scoring record
description: Stephen Curry breaks the Golden State Warriors' all-time points record as they overcome Denver Nuggets in the NBA.

title: England to play one-off Test against India & host New Zealand in summer
description: England will play a one-off Test against India as part of a summer schedule that also includes a limited-overs series with New Zealand.

title: Newspaper headlines: Brothers' tributes and Cameron 'welcomes' inquiry
description: The papers cover the princes' gratitude to their grandfather and a probe into the ex-PM's lobbying.

title: Afro wigs: Norfolk hair donor proud of 'historic breakthrough'
description: Carly Gorton, 11, had challenged a charity which said it could not make wigs using her hair.

title: Vote: Who's the greatest player in WSL history?
description: As the WSL reaches its 10-year anniversary, BBC Sport asks who is the greatest player in the history of the competition?

title: Scottish election 2021: Will the suspension of campaigning affect the Holyrood vote?
description: Holyrood election campaigning is to resume but will the suspension have any impact on the election?
